The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: German language, German culture, German history. German German German.
Further German practice in grammar and syntax, especially in writing.
Reading, speaking, writing, comprehension in German. Also good amount of German culture as well.

I mostly improved my grammar and writing skills. I wish we had spent more time on vocab, reading, and speaking.

Another strength  my wonderful classmates and the supercool Herr Patrick Wolf-Farre.

Intensive German is a strong course - all language courses should be in the two hour format. The book was good, balancing grammar and reading instruction. The amount of time for conversing in German was good as well. The only weakness might be that the book, with its focus on German speaking cities, somewhat limits itself in terms of the vocabulary it uses.
Do it. Gets you up early in the morning, and gets you pretty good at German. The department is wonderful  got to their events if you can.
Absolutely. Fantastic course with a fantastic professor.
Certainly! It is the way to learn German quickly and effectively in college.
Yes, I think that it was both clearly taught, and not too stressful for the students.
